commit.message:
configure.in: Revert AC_TYPE_GETGROUPS patch from June 13.

        * configure.in: Revert AC_TYPE_GETGROUPS patch from June 13.
        * configure, config.in: Rebuilt.

From-SVN: r34546

files.patch:
@@ -1,3 +1,8 @@
+Wed Jun 14 09:25:57 2000  Jeffrey A Law  (law@cygnus.com)
+
+	* configure.in: Revert AC_TYPE_GETGROUPS patch from June 13.
+	* configure, config.in: Rebuilt.
+
 Wed Jun 14 03:39:58 EDT 2000  John Wehle  (john@feith.com)
 
 	* ifcvt.c (EDGE_COMPLEX): Move definition ...

@@ -10,13 +10,6 @@
    This function is required for alloca.c support on those systems.  */
 #undef CRAY_STACKSEG_END
 
-/* Define to the type of elements in the array set by `getgroups'.
-   Usually this is either `int' or `gid_t'.  */
-#undef GETGROUPS_T
-
-/* Define to `int' if <sys/types.h> doesn't define.  */
-#undef gid_t
-
 /* Define if you have alloca, as a function or macro.  */
 #undef HAVE_ALLOCA
 
@@ -71,9 +64,6 @@
 /* Define if you can safely include both <sys/time.h> and <time.h>.  */
 #undef TIME_WITH_SYS_TIME
 
-/* Define to `int' if <sys/types.h> doesn't define.  */
-#undef uid_t
-
 /* Define vfork as fork if vfork does not work.  */
 #undef vfork

@@ -2542,119 +2542,13 @@ EOF
 fi
 
 
-echo $ac_n "checking for uid_t in sys/types.h""... $ac_c" 1>&6
-echo "configure:2547: checking for uid_t in sys/types.h" >&5
-if eval "test \"`echo '$''{'ac_cv_type_uid_t'+set}'`\" = set"; then
-  echo $ac_n "(cached) $ac_c" 1>&6
-else
-  cat > conftest.$ac_ext <<EOF
-#line 2552 "configure"
-#include "confdefs.h"
-#include <sys/types.h>
-EOF
-if (eval "$ac_cpp conftest.$ac_ext") 2>&5 |
-  egrep "uid_t" >/dev/null 2>&1; then
-  rm -rf conftest*
-  ac_cv_type_uid_t=yes
-else
-  rm -rf conftest*
-  ac_cv_type_uid_t=no
-fi
-rm -f conftest*
-
-fi
-
-echo "$ac_t""$ac_cv_type_uid_t" 1>&6
-if test $ac_cv_type_uid_t = no; then
-  cat >> confdefs.h <<\EOF
-#define uid_t int
-EOF
-
-  cat >> confdefs.h <<\EOF
-#define gid_t int
-EOF
-
-fi
-
-echo $ac_n "checking type of array argument to getgroups""... $ac_c" 1>&6
-echo "configure:2581: checking type of array argument to getgroups" >&5
-if eval "test \"`echo '$''{'ac_cv_type_getgroups'+set}'`\" = set"; then
-  echo $ac_n "(cached) $ac_c" 1>&6
-else
-  if test "$cross_compiling" = yes; then
-  ac_cv_type_getgroups=cross
-else
-  cat > conftest.$ac_ext <<EOF
-#line 2589 "configure"
-#include "confdefs.h"
-
-/* Thanks to Mike Rendell for this test.  */
-#include <sys/types.h>
-#define NGID 256
-#undef MAX
-#define MAX(x, y) ((x) > (y) ? (x) : (y))
-main()
-{
-  gid_t gidset[NGID];
-  int i, n;
-  union { gid_t gval; long lval; }  val;
-
-  val.lval = -1;
-  for (i = 0; i < NGID; i++)
-    gidset[i] = val.gval;
-  n = getgroups (sizeof (gidset) / MAX (sizeof (int), sizeof (gid_t)) - 1,
-                 gidset);
-  /* Exit non-zero if getgroups seems to require an array of ints.  This
-     happens when gid_t is short but getgroups modifies an array of ints.  */
-  exit ((n > 0 && gidset[n] != val.gval) ? 1 : 0);
-}
-
-EOF
-if { (eval echo configure:2614: \"$ac_link\") 1>&5; (eval $ac_link) 2>&5; } && test -s conftest${ac_exeext} && (./conftest; exit) 2>/dev/null
-then
-    ac_cv_type_getgroups=gid_t
-else
-  echo "configure: failed program was:" >&5
-  cat conftest.$ac_ext >&5
-  rm -fr conftest*
-  ac_cv_type_getgroups=int
-fi
-rm -fr conftest*
-fi
-
-if test $ac_cv_type_getgroups = cross; then
-        cat > conftest.$ac_ext <<EOF
-#line 2628 "configure"
-#include "confdefs.h"
-#include <unistd.h>
-EOF
-if (eval "$ac_cpp conftest.$ac_ext") 2>&5 |
-  egrep "getgroups.*int.*gid_t" >/dev/null 2>&1; then
-  rm -rf conftest*
-  ac_cv_type_getgroups=gid_t
-else
-  rm -rf conftest*
-  ac_cv_type_getgroups=int
-fi
-rm -f conftest*
-
-fi
-fi
-
-echo "$ac_t""$ac_cv_type_getgroups" 1>&6
-cat >> confdefs.h <<EOF
-#define GETGROUPS_T $ac_cv_type_getgroups
-EOF
-
-
-
 echo $ac_n "checking for vprintf""... $ac_c" 1>&6
-echo "configure:2653: checking for vprintf" >&5
+echo "configure:2547: checking for vprintf" >&5
 if eval "test \"`echo '$''{'ac_cv_func_vprintf'+set}'`\" = set"; then
   echo $ac_n "(cached) $ac_c" 1>&6
 else
   cat > conftest.$ac_ext <<EOF
-#line 2658 "configure"
+#line 2552 "configure"
 #include "confdefs.h"
 /* System header to define __stub macros and hopefully few prototypes,
     which can conflict with char vprintf(); below.  */
@@ -2677,7 +2571,7 @@ vprintf();
 
 ; return 0; }
 EOF
-if { (eval echo configure:2681: \"$ac_link\") 1>&5; (eval $ac_link) 2>&5; } && test -s conftest${ac_exeext}; then
+if { (eval echo configure:2575: \"$ac_link\") 1>&5; (eval $ac_link) 2>&5; } && test -s conftest${ac_exeext}; then
   rm -rf conftest*
   eval "ac_cv_func_vprintf=yes"
 else
@@ -2701,12 +2595,12 @@ fi
 
 if test "$ac_cv_func_vprintf" != yes; then
 echo $ac_n "checking for _doprnt""... $ac_c" 1>&6
-echo "configure:2705: checking for _doprnt" >&5
+echo "configure:2599: checking for _doprnt" >&5
 if eval "test \"`echo '$''{'ac_cv_func__doprnt'+set}'`\" = set"; then
   echo $ac_n "(cached) $ac_c" 1>&6
 else
   cat > conftest.$ac_ext <<EOF
-#line 2710 "configure"
+#line 2604 "configure"
 #include "confdefs.h"
 /* System header to define __stub macros and hopefully few prototypes,
     which can conflict with char _doprnt(); below.  */
@@ -2729,7 +2623,7 @@ _doprnt();
 
 ; return 0; }
 EOF
-if { (eval echo configure:2733: \"$ac_link\") 1>&5; (eval $ac_link) 2>&5; } && test -s conftest${ac_exeext}; then
+if { (eval echo configure:2627: \"$ac_link\") 1>&5; (eval $ac_link) 2>&5; } && test -s conftest${ac_exeext}; then
   rm -rf conftest*
   eval "ac_cv_func__doprnt=yes"
 else
@@ -2765,15 +2659,15 @@ fi
 
 
 echo $ac_n "checking whether the printf functions support %p""... $ac_c" 1>&6
-echo "configure:2769: checking whether the printf functions support %p" >&5
+echo "configure:2663: checking whether the printf functions support %p" >&5
 if eval "test \"`echo '$''{'gcc_cv_func_printf_ptr'+set}'`\" = set"; then
   echo $ac_n "(cached) $ac_c" 1>&6
 else
   if test "$cross_compiling" = yes; then
   gcc_cv_func_printf_ptr=no
 else
   cat > conftest.$ac_ext <<EOF
-#line 2777 "configure"
+#line 2671 "configure"
 #include "confdefs.h"
 #include <stdio.h>
 
@@ -2786,7 +2680,7 @@ int main()
   return (p != q);
 }
 EOF
-if { (eval echo configure:2790: \"$ac_link\") 1>&5; (eval $ac_link) 2>&5; } && test -s conftest${ac_exeext} && (./conftest; exit) 2>/dev/null
+if { (eval echo configure:2684: \"$ac_link\") 1>&5; (eval $ac_link) 2>&5; } && test -s conftest${ac_exeext} && (./conftest; exit) 2>/dev/null
 then
   gcc_cv_func_printf_ptr=yes
 else
@@ -2819,12 +2713,12 @@ case "${host}" in
   ;;
 esac
 echo $ac_n "checking for pid_t""... $ac_c" 1>&6
-echo "configure:2823: checking for pid_t" >&5
+echo "configure:2717: checking for pid_t" >&5
 if eval "test \"`echo '$''{'ac_cv_type_pid_t'+set}'`\" = set"; then
   echo $ac_n "(cached) $ac_c" 1>&6
 else
   cat > conftest.$ac_ext <<EOF
-#line 2828 "configure"
+#line 2722 "configure"
 #include "confdefs.h"
 #include <sys/types.h>
 #if STDC_HEADERS
@@ -2853,17 +2747,17 @@ fi
 
 ac_safe=`echo "vfork.h" | sed 'y%./+-%__p_%'`
 echo $ac_n "checking for vfork.h""... $ac_c" 1>&6
-echo "configure:2857: checking for vfork.h" >&5
+echo "configure:2751: checking for vfork.h" >&5
 if eval "test \"`echo '$''{'ac_cv_header_$ac_safe'+set}'`\" = set"; then
   echo $ac_n "(cached) $ac_c" 1>&6
 else
   cat > conftest.$ac_ext <<EOF
-#line 2862 "configure"
+#line 2756 "configure"
 #include "confdefs.h"
 #include <vfork.h>
 EOF
 ac_try="$ac_cpp conftest.$ac_ext >/dev/null 2>conftest.out"
-{ (eval echo configure:2867: \"$ac_try\") 1>&5; (eval $ac_try) 2>&5; }
+{ (eval echo configure:2761: \"$ac_try\") 1>&5; (eval $ac_try) 2>&5; }
 ac_err=`grep -v '^ *+' conftest.out | grep -v "^conftest.${ac_ext}\$"`
 if test -z "$ac_err"; then
   rm -rf conftest*
@@ -2888,18 +2782,18 @@ else
 fi
 
 echo $ac_n "checking for working vfork""... $ac_c" 1>&6
-echo "configure:2892: checking for working vfork" >&5
+echo "configure:2786: checking for working vfork" >&5
 if eval "test \"`echo '$''{'ac_cv_func_vfork_works'+set}'`\" = set"; then
   echo $ac_n "(cached) $ac_c" 1>&6
 else
   if test "$cross_compiling" = yes; then
   echo $ac_n "checking for vfork""... $ac_c" 1>&6
-echo "configure:2898: checking for vfork" >&5
+echo "configure:2792: checking for vfork" >&5
 if eval "test \"`echo '$''{'ac_cv_func_vfork'+set}'`\" = set"; then
   echo $ac_n "(cached) $ac_c" 1>&6
 else
   cat > conftest.$ac_ext <<EOF
-#line 2903 "configure"
+#line 2797 "configure"
 #include "confdefs.h"
 /* System header to define __stub macros and hopefully few prototypes,
     which can conflict with char vfork(); below.  */
@@ -2922,7 +2816,7 @@ vfork();
 
 ; return 0; }
 EOF
-if { (eval echo configure:2926: \"$ac_link\") 1>&5; (eval $ac_link) 2>&5; } && test -s conftest${ac_exeext}; then
+if { (eval echo configure:2820: \"$ac_link\") 1>&5; (eval $ac_link) 2>&5; } && test -s conftest${ac_exeext}; then
   rm -rf conftest*
   eval "ac_cv_func_vfork=yes"
 else
@@ -2944,7 +2838,7 @@ fi
 ac_cv_func_vfork_works=$ac_cv_func_vfork
 else
   cat > conftest.$ac_ext <<EOF
-#line 2948 "configure"
+#line 2842 "configure"
 #include "confdefs.h"
 /* Thanks to Paul Eggert for this test.  */
 #include <stdio.h>
@@ -3039,7 +2933,7 @@ main() {
   }
 }
 EOF
-if { (eval echo configure:3043: \"$ac_link\") 1>&5; (eval $ac_link) 2>&5; } && test -s conftest${ac_exeext} && (./conftest; exit) 2>/dev/null
+if { (eval echo configure:2937: \"$ac_link\") 1>&5; (eval $ac_link) 2>&5; } && test -s conftest${ac_exeext} && (./conftest; exit) 2>/dev/null
 then
   ac_cv_func_vfork_works=yes
 else
@@ -3065,17 +2959,17 @@ for ac_hdr in unistd.h
 do
 ac_safe=`echo "$ac_hdr" | sed 'y%./+-%__p_%'`
 echo $ac_n "checking for $ac_hdr""... $ac_c" 1>&6
-echo "configure:3069: checking for $ac_hdr" >&5
+echo "configure:2963: checking for $ac_hdr" >&5
 if eval "test \"`echo '$''{'ac_cv_header_$ac_safe'+set}'`\" = set"; then
   echo $ac_n "(cached) $ac_c" 1>&6
 else
   cat > conftest.$ac_ext <<EOF
-#line 3074 "configure"
+#line 2968 "configure"
 #include "confdefs.h"
 #include <$ac_hdr>
 EOF
 ac_try="$ac_cpp conftest.$ac_ext >/dev/null 2>conftest.out"
-{ (eval echo configure:3079: \"$ac_try\") 1>&5; (eval $ac_try) 2>&5; }
+{ (eval echo configure:2973: \"$ac_try\") 1>&5; (eval $ac_try) 2>&5; }
 ac_err=`grep -v '^ *+' conftest.out | grep -v "^conftest.${ac_ext}\$"`
 if test -z "$ac_err"; then
   rm -rf conftest*
@@ -3104,12 +2998,12 @@ done
 for ac_func in getpagesize
 do
 echo $ac_n "checking for $ac_func""... $ac_c" 1>&6
-echo "configure:3108: checking for $ac_func" >&5
+echo "configure:3002: checking for $ac_func" >&5
 if eval "test \"`echo '$''{'ac_cv_func_$ac_func'+set}'`\" = set"; then
   echo $ac_n "(cached) $ac_c" 1>&6
 else
   cat > conftest.$ac_ext <<EOF
-#line 3113 "configure"
+#line 3007 "configure"
 #include "confdefs.h"
 /* System header to define __stub macros and hopefully few prototypes,
     which can conflict with char $ac_func(); below.  */
@@ -3132,7 +3026,7 @@ $ac_func();
 
 ; return 0; }
 EOF
-if { (eval echo configure:3136: \"$ac_link\") 1>&5; (eval $ac_link) 2>&5; } && test -s conftest${ac_exeext}; then
+if { (eval echo configure:3030: \"$ac_link\") 1>&5; (eval $ac_link) 2>&5; } && test -s conftest${ac_exeext}; then
   rm -rf conftest*
   eval "ac_cv_func_$ac_func=yes"
 else
@@ -3157,15 +3051,15 @@ fi
 done
 
 echo $ac_n "checking for working mmap from /dev/zero""... $ac_c" 1>&6
-echo "configure:3161: checking for working mmap from /dev/zero" >&5
+echo "configure:3055: checking for working mmap from /dev/zero" >&5
 if eval "test \"`echo '$''{'ac_cv_func_mmap_anywhere'+set}'`\" = set"; then
   echo $ac_n "(cached) $ac_c" 1>&6
 else
   if test "$cross_compiling" = yes; then
   ac_cv_func_mmap_anywhere=no
 else
   cat > conftest.$ac_ext <<EOF
-#line 3169 "configure"
+#line 3063 "configure"
 #include "confdefs.h"
 
 /* Test by Richard Henderson and Alexandre Oliva.
@@ -3237,7 +3131,7 @@ int main()
   exit(0);
 }
 EOF
-if { (eval echo configure:3241: \"$ac_link\") 1>&5; (eval $ac_link) 2>&5; } && test -s conftest${ac_exeext} && (./conftest; exit) 2>/dev/null
+if { (eval echo configure:3135: \"$ac_link\") 1>&5; (eval $ac_link) 2>&5; } && test -s conftest${ac_exeext} && (./conftest; exit) 2>/dev/null
 then
   ac_cv_func_mmap_anywhere=yes
 else
@@ -3260,7 +3154,7 @@ EOF
 fi
 
 echo $ac_n "checking for working mmap of a file""... $ac_c" 1>&6
-echo "configure:3264: checking for working mmap of a file" >&5
+echo "configure:3158: checking for working mmap of a file" >&5
 if eval "test \"`echo '$''{'ac_cv_func_mmap_file'+set}'`\" = set"; then
   echo $ac_n "(cached) $ac_c" 1>&6
 else
@@ -3275,7 +3169,7 @@ if test "$cross_compiling" = yes; then
   ac_cv_func_mmap_file=no
 else
   cat > conftest.$ac_ext <<EOF
-#line 3279 "configure"
+#line 3173 "configure"
 #include "confdefs.h"
 
 /* Test by Zack Weinberg.  Modified from MMAP_ANYWHERE test by
@@ -3312,7 +3206,7 @@ int main()
   exit(0);
 }
 EOF
-if { (eval echo configure:3316: \"$ac_link\") 1>&5; (eval $ac_link) 2>&5; } && test -s conftest${ac_exeext} && (./conftest; exit) 2>/dev/null
+if { (eval echo configure:3210: \"$ac_link\") 1>&5; (eval $ac_link) 2>&5; } && test -s conftest${ac_exeext} && (./conftest; exit) 2>/dev/null
 then
   ac_cv_func_mmap_file=yes
 else
@@ -3345,12 +3239,12 @@ for ac_func in bcopy bzero bcmp \
 do
   ac_tr_decl=HAVE_DECL_`echo $ac_func | tr 'abcdefghijklmnopqrstuvwxyz' 'ABCDEFGHIJKLMNOPQRSTUVWXYZ'`
 echo $ac_n "checking whether $ac_func is declared""... $ac_c" 1>&6
-echo "configure:3349: checking whether $ac_func is declared" >&5
+echo "configure:3243: checking whether $ac_func is declared" >&5
 if eval "test \"`echo '$''{'gcc_cv_have_decl_$ac_func'+set}'`\" = set"; then
   echo $ac_n "(cached) $ac_c" 1>&6
 else
   cat > conftest.$ac_ext <<EOF
-#line 3354 "configure"
+#line 3248 "configure"
 #include "confdefs.h"
 #include "gansidecl.h"
 #include "system.h"
@@ -3361,7 +3255,7 @@ char *(*pfn) = (char *(*)) $ac_func ;
 #endif
 ; return 0; }
 EOF
-if { (eval echo configure:3365: \"$ac_compile\") 1>&5; (eval $ac_compile) 2>&5; }; then
+if { (eval echo configure:3259: \"$ac_compile\") 1>&5; (eval $ac_compile) 2>&5; }; then
   rm -rf conftest*
   eval "gcc_cv_have_decl_$ac_func=yes"
 else
@@ -3466,12 +3360,12 @@ for ac_func in getrlimit setrlimit getrusage
 do
   ac_tr_decl=HAVE_DECL_`echo $ac_func | tr 'abcdefghijklmnopqrstuvwxyz' 'ABCDEFGHIJKLMNOPQRSTUVWXYZ'`
 echo $ac_n "checking whether $ac_func is declared""... $ac_c" 1>&6
-echo "configure:3470: checking whether $ac_func is declared" >&5
+echo "configure:3364: checking whether $ac_func is declared" >&5
 if eval "test \"`echo '$''{'gcc_cv_have_decl_$ac_func'+set}'`\" = set"; then
   echo $ac_n "(cached) $ac_c" 1>&6
 else
   cat > conftest.$ac_ext <<EOF
-#line 3475 "configure"
+#line 3369 "configure"
 #include "confdefs.h"
 #include "gansidecl.h"
 #include "system.h"
@@ -3486,7 +3380,7 @@ char *(*pfn) = (char *(*)) $ac_func ;
 #endif
 ; return 0; }
 EOF
-if { (eval echo configure:3490: \"$ac_compile\") 1>&5; (eval $ac_compile) 2>&5; }; then
+if { (eval echo configure:3384: \"$ac_compile\") 1>&5; (eval $ac_compile) 2>&5; }; then
   rm -rf conftest*
   eval "gcc_cv_have_decl_$ac_func=yes"
 else
@@ -3529,12 +3423,12 @@ CFLAGS="$saved_CFLAGS"
 
 # mkdir takes a single argument on some systems. 
 echo $ac_n "checking if mkdir takes one argument""... $ac_c" 1>&6
-echo "configure:3533: checking if mkdir takes one argument" >&5
+echo "configure:3427: checking if mkdir takes one argument" >&5
 if eval "test \"`echo '$''{'gcc_cv_mkdir_takes_one_arg'+set}'`\" = set"; then
   echo $ac_n "(cached) $ac_c" 1>&6
 else
   cat > conftest.$ac_ext <<EOF
-#line 3538 "configure"
+#line 3432 "configure"
 #include "confdefs.h"
 
 #include <sys/types.h>
@@ -3551,7 +3445,7 @@ int main() {
 mkdir ("foo", 0);
 ; return 0; }
 EOF
-if { (eval echo configure:3555: \"$ac_compile\") 1>&5; (eval $ac_compile) 2>&5; }; then
+if { (eval echo configure:3449: \"$ac_compile\") 1>&5; (eval $ac_compile) 2>&5; }; then
   rm -rf conftest*
   gcc_cv_mkdir_takes_one_arg=no
 else
@@ -7036,15 +6930,15 @@ fi
 
 
         echo $ac_n "checking for strerror in -lcposix""... $ac_c" 1>&6
-echo "configure:7040: checking for strerror in -lcposix" >&5
+echo "configure:6934: checking for strerror in -lcposix" >&5
 ac_lib_var=`echo cposix'_'strerror | sed 'y%./+-%__p_%'`
 if eval "test \"`echo '$''{'ac_cv_lib_$ac_lib_var'+set}'`\" = set"; then
   echo $ac_n "(cached) $ac_c" 1>&6
 else
   ac_save_LIBS="$LIBS"
 LIBS="-lcposix  $LIBS"
 cat > conftest.$ac_ext <<EOF
-#line 7048 "configure"
+#line 6942 "configure"
 #include "confdefs.h"
 /* Override any gcc2 internal prototype to avoid an error.  */
 /* We use char because int might match the return type of a gcc2
@@ -7055,7 +6949,7 @@ int main() {
 strerror()
 ; return 0; }
 EOF
-if { (eval echo configure:7059: \"$ac_link\") 1>&5; (eval $ac_link) 2>&5; } && test -s conftest${ac_exeext}; then
+if { (eval echo configure:6953: \"$ac_link\") 1>&5; (eval $ac_link) 2>&5; } && test -s conftest${ac_exeext}; then
   rm -rf conftest*
   eval "ac_cv_lib_$ac_lib_var=yes"
 else
@@ -7078,12 +6972,12 @@ fi
   
 
 echo $ac_n "checking for working const""... $ac_c" 1>&6
-echo "configure:7082: checking for working const" >&5
+echo "configure:6976: checking for working const" >&5
 if eval "test \"`echo '$''{'ac_cv_c_const'+set}'`\" = set"; then

 else
   cat > conftest.$ac_ext <<EOF
-#line 7087 "configure"
+#line 6981 "configure"
 #include "confdefs.h"
 
 int main() {
@@ -7132,7 +7026,7 @@ ccp = (char const *const *) p;
 
 ; return 0; }
 EOF
-if { (eval echo configure:7136: \"$ac_compile\") 1>&5; (eval $ac_compile) 2>&5; }; then
+if { (eval echo configure:7030: \"$ac_compile\") 1>&5; (eval $ac_compile) 2>&5; }; then
   rm -rf conftest*
   ac_cv_c_const=yes
 else
@@ -7153,12 +7047,12 @@ EOF
 fi
 
 echo $ac_n "checking for off_t""... $ac_c" 1>&6
-echo "configure:7157: checking for off_t" >&5
+echo "configure:7051: checking for off_t" >&5
 if eval "test \"`echo '$''{'ac_cv_type_off_t'+set}'`\" = set"; then
   echo $ac_n "(cached) $ac_c" 1>&6
 else
   cat > conftest.$ac_ext <<EOF
-#line 7162 "configure"
+#line 7056 "configure"
 #include "confdefs.h"
 #include <sys/types.h>
 #if STDC_HEADERS
@@ -7186,12 +7080,12 @@ EOF
 fi
 
 echo $ac_n "checking for size_t""... $ac_c" 1>&6
